description: Margaret Hamilton is an American computer scientist, systems engineer and business owner. She was director of the Software Engineering Division of the MIT Instrumentation Laboratory.

associations.name: Higher Order Software
associations.description: Hamilton co-founded with Saydean Zeldin Higher Order Software (HOS) to further develop ideas about error prevention and fault tolerance emerging from their experience at MIT working on the Apollo program.

associations.name: Hamilton Technologies
associations.description: At Hamilton Technologies, Hamilton created Universal Systems Language, another step in making the process of designing systems more dependable.

employment.notes: Hamilton developed software for predicting weather, programming on the LGP-30 and the PDP-1 computers at Marvin Minsky's Project MAC

Hamilton worked on the Semi-Automatic Ground Environment (SAGE) Project, and it was her efforts on this project that made her a candidate for the position at NASA as the lead developer for Apollo flight software
Hamilton led a team credited with developing the software for Apollo and Skylab

accomplishment.description: Hamilton received the Augusta Ada Lovelace Award by the Association for Women in Computing.
Hamilton was given the NASA Exceptional Space Act Award for scientific and technical contributions. The award included $37,200, the largest amount awarded to any individual in NASA's history.
Hamilton received the Outstanding Alumni Award by Earlham College.
Hamilton received the Presidential Medal of Freedom from Barack Obama, the highest civilian honor in the United States.

accomplishment.short_description: Honorary Doctorate from Polytechnic University of Catalonia
